original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka‘s shares edge up in mid day trade, on a wait on see and approach as the International Monetary Fund approval discussions come ahead close, Ranjan Ranatunga of First Capital Holdings said.
“Shares were pretty volatile today, as investors have adopted a wait and see approach because the IMF is to have its discussions with Sri Lanka on Monday,” Ranatunga said.
“We’re confident that we will get the approvals. It’s vital to us,” State Minister of Finance, Shehan Semasinghe said.
All Share Price Index was up 0.33 percent or 31.82 points to 9,628, the most liquid index was S&P SL20 was up 0.49 percent or 13.82 points to 8,828.43.
Turnover was pretty slow and generated 515 million rupees, as investors waited on the sidelines in place of bulk investing.
Top gainers were Lanka IOC, Hayleys and Commercial Bank. (Colombo/Mar17/2023)
